oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alfred "Uncle Alfred" Jackson (circa 1812-1901), body servant of Andrew Jackson, sitting in his red cedar log cabin (built in 1841) at the Hermitage. A quilt is visible on the bed.

Alfred's mother Betty (1793-1870) was the Jackson's cook; his uncle George was Jackson's personal servant and later the family carriage driver. Alfred assisted with the horses, maintained the wagons and farm equipment, and after emancipation was a tenant farmer at the Hermitage. He became a handyman and tour guide after the Hermitage became a museum. He lived at the Hermitage until his death and is buried near Andrew and Rachel Jackson.
